meanings.definition: To play a fife or similar instrument.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys fifing tunes on her fife during parades.
meanings.sent2: The musician was fifing a cheerful melody at the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried fifing on a tiny fife, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fifing of the wind through the trees created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: His fifing skills were so impressive that everyone stopped to listen.

meanings.definition: The act of playing a fife.
meanings.sent1: The fifing at the concert added a lively touch to the music.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the fifing echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fifing in the library startled the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her fifing was like a bird's song in the early morning.
meanings.sent5: The sweet fifing of the children brightened up the room.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound, like that of a fife.
meanings.sent1: The fifing of the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent2: The distant fifing of the birds filled the air with music.
meanings.sent3: The old radio made a strange fifing noise before it finally turned on.
meanings.sent4: The fifing of the teapot was a welcome sound on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The eerie fifing of the wind gave the night an eerie feel.
